content:
• Friday, June 1, 2018
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks taps Arora to lead, reports record early results; shares +2.7%

    • Nikesh Arora -- former chief operating officer at SoftBank and chief business officer at Google -- is the new CEO and chairman of Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW), the company announces.
    • The move is effective June 6.
    • Arora takes over for Mark McLaughlin, who will transition to vice chairman of the board.
    • The company also says preliminary results show record revenues and billings for its fiscal third quarter. The company will post revenues that grew 31% to $567M (product revenue up 31% to $215.2M), and billings that grew 33% to $721M.
    • "We had a strong fiscal third quarter 2018 and will be reporting top line and bottom line results above all our third quarter guided ranges," says CFO Kathy Bonanno.
    • It will report and hold its earnings call before the market opens Monday June 4.
    • Shares are up 2.7% in late Friday trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:53 PM | 4 Comments
  • AGMH

    AGMH gains after plan to start asset management unit in Hong Kong

    • AGM Group Holdings (NASDAQ:AGMH) +4.1% after agreeing to buy a 75% equity stake in SIFT Capital Partners, a Hong Kong-based asset management firm, for HK$6M (about US$760,000).
    • Separately, AGMH agrees to acquire 100% equity interest in AGM Global Asset Management, a Cayman Islands company, from a related party for a nominal amount. AGM Global is not conducting any business currently.
    • "Through these businesses, we plan to carry out technology research and development underlying the crypto-currency investments we plan to make, including Bitcoin, Ethereum, EOS, Stellar, Dash, Tether, and FilmC," says AGMH Chairman Zhentao Jiang.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, OTCPK:BTLLF SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, OTCPK:BLKCF, COINB, BTC-USD, ETH-USD, XRP-USD, BCH-USD
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM | 9 Comments
  • WIN

    Windstream to offer $18M in shares via Citi

    • Windstream Holdings (NASDAQ:WIN) -- down 3.9% in some light Friday postmarket action -- has filed to offer $18M in shares via Citigroup Global Markets.
    • It intends to use proceeds for general purposes "including, without limitation, the acquisition of companies or businesses and additional contributions to the Windstream Pension Plan."
    • Shares fell by double digits earlier this week on word that the company was seeking a credit amendment.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM | 28 Comments
  • TTD

    Trade Desk gains cut back after Citron warns on Apple's ad move

    • Andrew Left and Citron Research weren't done moving stocks this week after goosing Snap yesterday; a late afternoon tweet about The Trade Desk (NASDAQ:TTD) likely spurred investors to pare gains in the ad-tech stock.
    • Pointing to a report about Apple's latest toe dipped into digital advertising, Citron tweets "$TTD watch out. Look who might be selling ads outside of the walled gardens $AAPL."
    • "A gamechanger in the ad world if WSJ reports on WWDC are true. Expect lower take rates fast. Analysts $80 $TTD targets might be too generous," Citron continues.
    • Up as much as 6.8% today, TTD pared gains into the close to finish up just 1.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 30 Comments
  • NAV

    Navistar +4% as Longbow upgrades, turning bullish on commercial trucking

    • Navistar (NAV +4.2%) powers higher after Longbow upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral with a $50 price target, citing a stronger outlook from contacts, market share growth, and expectations that the truck segment will return to profitability starting in FY 2018 driven by NAV's restructuring efforts and higher Class 8 end market demand.
    • Longbow says NAV has significant earnings power that could lead to positive manufacturing free cash flow in FY 2019, which will help to reduce debt, and believes the company likely will raise its industry and financial guidance when it reports Q2 results on June 5.
    • The firm also upgrades Rush Enterprises (RUSHA, RUSHB) to Buy from Neutral with a $55 price target, with strong broad-based demand expected to lift truck sales and aftermarket business.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZYME

    Zymeworks halted pending news

    • Nasdaq has suspended trading in Zymeworks (ZYME +7.6%) pending the release of news.
    • Update: Phase 1 data on lead candidate ZW25, presented at ASCO, showed a positive effect in patients with heavily pretreated HER2-positive cancers. As a single agent, it produced a disease control rate (DCR) of 48% (n=16/33), including 12 partial responders. 68% (n=21/31) experienced decreases in target lesions.
    • In 18 breast cancer patients with a median of six prior systemic treatments, the DCR was 50%. In nine gastroesophageal cancer patients (median of four prior treatments) the DCR was 56%. In six other HER2-positive cancer patients, including colorectal cancer, the DCR was 67%.
    • No dose-limiting toxicities were observed. Most adverse events were mild or moderate.
    • ZW25 is a bispecific antibody that can simultaneously bind to two non-overlapping epitopes of HER2, thereby increasing binding and removal of HER2 protein from the cell surface and boosting efficacy.
    • Previously: Zymeworks' lead candidate shows positive action in early-stage study; shares up 1% (Dec. 5, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • SFL

    Ship Finance +5% as Seaport upgrades, says 'back playing offense'

    • Ship Finance International (SFL +4.9%) surges after Seaport Global upgrades to Buy from Neutral with an $18 price target, seeing the company "back playing offense" and ready to support its dividend growth.
    • Seaport says SFLs risk/reward is increasingly attractive with several potential catalysts developing over the next few months, combined with the Seadrill restructuring behind it and already reflected in estimates.
    • The firm thinks SFL boasts ample liquidity to start pursuing attractive acquisition opportunities to grow its distributable cash flow, and current backlog provides cash flow visibility and dividend support.
    • Earlier: Ship Finance beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (May 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 5 Comments
  • VIVHY

    Vivendi's Bollore sticks to Italy despite investment setbacks

    • Despite a heavy setback in Vivendi's (VIVHY +0.5%) move to control a number of Italian media/telecom investments, billionaire Vincent Bollore (BOIVF +1.6%) says the company will keep its investments in the country.
    • The French media giant built stakes in Telecom Italia (TI +1.6%) and Mediaset (MDIUY +1.7%), but recently lost control of the TI board amid an activist push by Elliott Management.
    • "Italy is not a done deal yet," Bollore said at today's annual shareholder meeting. "It's a deal that will eventually bear fruit ... I continue to believe that what is going on there is interesting."
    • As for Elliott's move on Telecom Italia: "For the moment, I'm not impressed by what they're doing ... As long as they're not dismantling, we'll leave things be."
    • Previously: Telecom Italia confirms Genish as CEO; Vivendi signals support (May. 07 2018)
    • Previously: Elliott gains control of Telecom Italia (May. 04 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • LKM

    Link Motion +14% for fourth straight day of gains

    • Micro-cap Link Motion (NYSE:LKM) is up 14.3% on above-average volume on no apparent news, but its fourth straight day of gains in this four-day trading week.
    • It's reached its highest point since May 15, before a plunge spurred by news about delays in its financial reports. The stock recovered somewhat May 22 as the company addressed the reports in a shareholder letter.
    • Shares have lost 72% of value in 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • RSLS

    ReShape to reverse split shares 1:15 effective June 4; shares down 2%

    • Aimed at regaining compliance with Nasdaq's $1 minimum bid price requirement, ReShape Lifesciences (OTC:RSLS -1.6%) executes a 1:15 reverse split of its common stock. Post-split trading will commence  Monday, June 4.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • I

    Intelsat in multi-year deal to speed Myanmar deployment

    • Intelsat (NYSE:I) has announced a broader relationship with Myanmar in order to speed up deployment of the country's wireless infrastructure.
    • The two have a multi-year, multi-transponder agreement. Myanmar's Ministry of Transport and Communications will use services (both C-band and Ku-band) on Intelsat 39, set to replace Intelsat 902 in 2019.
    • The plan is to dramatically increase overall bandwidth, speed and reliability of the mobile network by integrating satellite services as 3G and 4G expand into more remote areas.
    • Shares are down 3.1% today in NYSE trading on heavier than average volume amid some profit-taking after the stock's latest move up based on mid-band monetization prospects.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • MSFT

    Business Insider: Microsoft in talks to acquire GitHub

    • Business Insider sources say Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) is in talks to buy software development platform GitHub, which was last valued at $2B.
    • The companies have talked over the years but those conversations have intensified in recent weeks. 
    • GitHub had wanted to pursue an IPO but has struggled to replace founder and CEO Chris Wanstrath, who resigned last August but remains in the role while a replacement is found.   
    • Microsoft shares are up 1.7% to $100.50.    
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 28 Comments
  • GLNG

    Golar LNG edges up after rout but Golar LNG Partners -12% on downgrade

    • Golar LNG (GLNG +0.8%) edges higher following yesterday's 26% rout, sparked by the dissolution of the OneLNG joint venture with Schlumberger that raises more doubts on the Fortuna project and further upstream expansion.
    • Morgan Stanley analyst Fotis Giannakoulis says the pullback was overdone, keeping his Overweight rating on the stock while lowering its price target to $31 from $36, saying his FLNG thesis remains intact as the Hilli Episeyo already is producing cargoes in Cameroon, while the recent agreement with BP for the Torture project in Mauritania and Senagal also confirms the value proposition.
    • Meanwhile, Gloar LNG Partners (GMLP -12.1%) is slammed as BofA Merrill Lynch issues a double-notch downgrade to Underperform from Buy with a $16 price target, cut from $24, citing concerns about the lack of clarity on cash flows and the sustainability of the dividend after net income fell 37% Y/Y and distributable cash flow declined to $13.3M, leaving a troubling 0.32 coverage ratio.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 110 Comments
  • VMW

    VMware plans to expand to Microsoft, Google cloud platforms

    • VMware (NYSE:VMW) CEO Patrick Gelsinger says the company will expand its services to Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) Azure and Google Cloud after launching on Amazon Web Services last year.
    • Gelsinger to CNBC: “We have interest from our customers to expand our relationships with Google, Microsoft and others. We have announced some incremental expansions of those agreements.” 
    • AWS remains the cloud market leader as of Q1 with a 33% market share, according to Synergy Research Group data, but the shares of Microsoft and Google grew more on the year. 
    • VMware shares are up 6.6% to $146.56.  
    • Previously: VMware +3.1% on Q1 beats, upside revenue guidance (May 31)
    • Previously: Analysts raise VMware price targets after earnings (June 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 8 Comments
  • CHNR

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/01/2018)

    • Gainers: CHNR +49%. NGL +9%. WMLP-OLD +9%. CLMT +8%. DK +7%.
    • Losers: PBR-A -15%. PBR -14%. ZN -11%. VNOM -10%. JAG -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 4 Comments
  • GOOG

    Analyst color on Alphabet's Fiat partnership, GDPR risks

    • Morgan Stanley analyst Brian Nowak tells clients that the Fiat Chrysler adding as many as 62k vehicles to Alphabet’s  (GOOG, GOOGL) Waymo fleet shows the self-driving vehicle “arms race” heating up.
    • MKM Partners analyst Rob Sanderson tells clients that GDPR is more likely to help than hurt Google as it’s better insulated than smaller competitors and is less dependent on third-party data. 
    • Morgan Stanley has Alphabet at an Overweight rating and $1,200 price target. 
    • MKM Partners has Alphabet at Buy with a $1,355 target.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word. 
    • GOOG shares are up 3.2% to $1,119.64.   
    • Previously: Fiat Chrysler, Waymo expand partnership with 65K vehicles (May 31)
    • Previously: Apple looks to ad growth with new app network (June 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 5 Comments
  • EDR

    Sudden jump for Education Realty Trust

    • There's no news out there, but Education Realty Trust (NYSE:EDR) quickly spiked higher by about 5% minutes ago. Shares are currently up 4%.
    • Update: There is unconfirmed chatter about talks with buyout firms, and M&A in the roughed-up REIT sector has been fairly busy of late.
    • Update at 1:30 ET: The WSJ reports EDR as having talks with private-equity firms about a sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • SPOT

    Spotify walks back hate conduct policy amid industry revolt

    • After a backlash from industry partners, Spotify (SPOT +1.7%) says it's backing away from a policy aimed at artist conduct.
    • In a policy update, the company says that "while we believe our intentions were good, the language was too vague, we created confusion and concern, and didn't spend enough time getting input from our own team and key partners before sharing new guidelines."
    • The company had banned musicians R. Kelly and XXXTentacion from playlists based on its policies around hate speech and hateful conduct.
    • CEO Daniel Ek says "We rolled this out wrong."
    • "We don't aim to play judge and jury," the company says about the first part of the policy, related to promotional decisions in case of the most extreme artist controversies. "Across all genres, our role is not to regulate artists. Therefore, we are moving away from implementing a policy around artist conduct."
    • As far as hate content: "As we’ve done before, we will remove content that violates that standard. We’re not talking about offensive, explicit, or vulgar content – we’re talking about hate speech."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 6 Comments
  • V

    Visa reports service disruption in Europe

    • There are multiple reports coming in from merchants and customers in Europe on a service disruption with Visa (V +0.5%) cards.
    • The company has acknowledged that some transactions in Europe aren't being processed.
    • Shares of Visa have fallen back from their earlier level.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 3 Comments
  • AMBC

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (06/01/2018)

    • Gainers: AMBC +9%. FSP +6%. YRD +6%. YRIV +5%.
    • Losers: SRC -12%. CARV -8%. DNJR -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • TSLA

    Tesla workers paint an alarming picture on safety

    • Current Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) employees tell CNBC that at least four fires have occurred in the paint shop of the Fremont factory over the last few years.
    • The sources laid the blame for the fires on the company's lack of proper maintenance, training and cleaning procedures. They also said a recent fire in April (which was previously disclosed) contributed to a slowing down of Model 3 production and has created health concerns.
    • A Tesla spokesperson said the April fire wasn't "significant" in nature and highlighted the safety procedures the company now has in place.
    • Shares of Tesla are up 1.66% on the day, almost fully recovering from a minor stumble yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 112 Comments
  • GOOG

    Apple looks to ad growth with new app network

    • Apple (AAPL +1.7%) is eyeing a revenue shift that would mean a gradual move from device manufacturing toward digital advertising, with an eye toward expanding its ad business into ground covered more by Facebook (FB +1.1%) and Google (GOOG +3.1%, GOOGL +3.2%), The Wall Street Journal reports.
    • The tech giant has reportedly met with companies including Snap and Pinterest about taking part in a network distributing ads across apps, in a revenue-share arrangement that would vary by app.
    • Apple already has a small business ($1B revenue last year) selling promo ads for search terms in the App Store.
    • Services already look to be a growth opportunity for the company, with iPhone growth slowing amid a more saturated smartphone market.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 57 Comments

  • Tech leads rally on Wall Street

    • A rally in Europe (up 1% as the Italy panic subsided for at least a day) got things started for equity markets. The very perky May employment report then sent interest rates higher, but stocks don't seem concerned.
    • Just before 1 ET, the Nasdaq is up 1.5% and the S&P 5090 1.1%. Best performers in tech include Google and Intel, both up more than 3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • CODX

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/01/2018)

    • Gainers: CODX +92%. CHNR +82%. CLWT +32%. ZUO +20%. LULU +17%. AXON +17%. DHX +15%. TTOO +14%. DDE +13%. CWBR +12%.
    • Losers: UONE -20%. ONVO -19%. PAVM -18%. SHLD -18%. KTOV -17%. PBR-A -15%. PBR -14%. GMLP -13%. CRIS -13%. SRC -12%.
      •  
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • HFC

    EPA gives millions in ethanol credits to oil refiners including HollyFrontier

    • The Environmental Protection Agency has awarded tens of millions of dollars worth of retroactive biofuels credits to two oil refiners - HollyFrontier (HFC +4%) and privately-held Sinclair Oil - after they argued the agency had wrongly denied them waivers from U.S. biofuels law as far back as 2014.
    • The most recent credits, awarded months ago and first reported yesterday by Reuters, are the first publicly known retroactive waivers and provide unprecedented help for refining operations that is sparking a conflict between energy companies and corn growers.
    • The EPA reportedly gave HFC nearly $34M worth of credits for this year to reverse a denial for a waiver for one of its Wyoming plants dating back to 2015 and undisclosed millions more to Sinclair for two of its facilities in the same state for 2014 and 2015.
    • The EPA’s move may put even more pressure on credit prices, which have plunged to five-year lows amid the agency’s expansion of the small refinery waiver program.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 9 Comments
  • ZUO

    Zuora stock jumps 18.9% post Q1 results

    • Zuora (ZUO +18.9%) reports Q1 revenue growth of 60% Y/Y to $51.7M of which Subscription revenue was $36.1M (+39% Y/Y) & Professional services of $15.6M (+147.6% Y/Y).
    • Customers with annual contract value equal to or greater than $100,000 increased to 441 customers (+6% Q/Q).
    • Dollar based retention rate increased to 112%, up 2% from Q4.
    • Customer usage of Zuora solutions grew, with $7.2B (+46% Y/Y) in transaction volume through Zuora’s billing platform.
    • Q1 overall margins: Adj. gross declined 900 bps to 54%; Adj. subscription gross margin decline 300 bps to 76%. Adj. operating declined 619 bps to -26.3%
    • Cash & equivalents of $207.7M; CFO was $7.8M & FCF of -$9.6M.
    • Q2 Outlook: Total revenue of $53.5-54.5M; Subscription revenue of $38-38.5M; Adj. loss from operations of $16-15M; Adj. EPS of $(0.16)-(0.15), assuming shares of ~105M.
    • 2019 Outlook: Total revenue of $220-223M; Subscription revenue of $158-159.5M; Adj. loss from operations of $55-52M; Adj. EPS of $(0.62)-(0.59), assuming shares of ~92M.
    • Previously: Zuora beats by $0.08, beats on revenue (May 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • LULU

    Consumer - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (06/01/2018)

    • Gainers: LULU +16%. BRFS +7%. FTFT +7%. LTRPA +5%. SGOC +5%.
    • Losers: TIS -12%. FCAU -7%. UG -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • RHHBY

    EC OKs expanded use for Roche's cancer med Perjeta; shares up 2%

    • The European Commission approves Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY +1.9%) Perjeta (pertuzumab), in combination with Herceptin (trastuzumab) and chemo, for post-surgery treatment of adult patients with HER2-positive early breast cancer at high risk of recurrence.
    • The data supporting the approval was generated in the Phase 3 APHINITY study that showed treatment with Perjeta significantly reduced the risk of invasive breast cancer recurrence or death compared to Herceptin and chemo alone.
    • Perjeta was previously approved to treat advanced (metastatic) HER2-positive breast cancer.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 2 Comments
  • MRVL

    Semiconductors strong after Marvell earnings beat, AMD target boost

    • Semiconductor stocks are ending the week on an up note after Marvell Tech (MRVL +2.8%) reported a Q1 beat yesterday and Stifel raised its AMD (AMD +3.8%) price target this morning.
    • Other movers: Intel (INTC +3.2%), Xilinx (XLNX +3.6%), Nvidia (NVDA +1.8%), Qorvo (QRVO +1.4%), Cavium (CAVM +1.3%), Integrated Device (IDTI +1.4%), Maxim (MXIM +1.8%), Teradyne (TER +1.7%), Lam Research (LRCX +2%), Applied Materials (AMAT +2.4%), On Semiconductors (ON +2%). 
    • The Philadelphia Semiconductor Index is up 1.7%. 
    • Previously: Marvell Technology Q1 EPS beat, in-line guidance (May 31)
    • Previously: AMD +3.7% on Stifel price target increase (June 1)
    • Semiconductor ETFs: SOXL, SOXX, SMH, USD, PSI, XSD, SOXS, SSG, FTXL, XTH
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 21 Comments
  • AMD

    AMD +3.7% on Stifel price target increase

    • Stifel raises its Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) price target from $14 to $17.
    • Analyst Kevin Cassidy sees “end demand forecasts for PCs, servers and graphics add-in-cards as increasing.” 
    • Cassidy was also encouraged by the introduction of a Cisco platform using AMD’s Epyc 7000 series processors and thinks other OEMS have realized Epyc’s benefits and “will be making similar announcements soon.” 
    • Rating reiterated at Buy. 
    • Advanced Micro Devices shares are up 3.7% to $14.24.   
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 89 Comments
  • NLST

    Netlist +48.5% on ITC order

    • Netlist (OTC:NLST) jumps 48.5% to $0.26 after announcing that the US International Trade Commission issued a remand order in the investigation of SK Hynix’s memory products.
    • The ITC agreed with Netlist that an Administrative Law Judge inappropriately granted SK Hynix’s motion for a non-infringement determination. The judge had also terminated the investigation. 
    • The investigation now reopens and heads back to the ALJ for consideration.  
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • TROV

    Trovagene continues long-term selloff, down 8%

    • Nano cap Trovagene (TROV -8.3%) adds to its slide on average volume. After the close yesterday, it announced a 1:12 reverse stock split aimed at regaining compliance with Nasdaq's $1 minimum bid price listing requirement.
    • Post-split trading will commence on Monday, June 4.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 7 Comments
  • CODX

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (06/01/2018)

    • Gainers: CODX +69%. AXON +14%. FWP +9%. AGLE +9%. TTOO +9%.
    • Losers: PAVM -18%. KTOV -17%. AIPT -11%. ONVO -10%. CTRV -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 4 Comments
  • ELLI

    Ellie Mae announces departure of CFO

    • Ellie Mae (ELLI -2.5%) announces departure of EVP & CFO Matthew LaVay for personal reasons effective June 15.
    • The company names Popi Heron as interim CFO.
    • Additionally, Ed Luce, the company’s former CFO, is joining the company as an advisor to support the company’s finance and accounting organization and assist in its search for a successor.
    • The company also announced that there is no change to its financial guidance for the Q218.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • ONVO

    Organovo FQ4 miss pressures shares, down 10%

    • Organovo Holdings (ONVO -9.9%) is down on modestly higher volume after reporting fiscal Q4 and fiscal 2018 results yesterday after the close.
    • Revenues: $1.1M (+36.1%); Product and Services revenues: $905K (+17.4%); net loss: (7.4) (+30.1%).
    • Fiscal 2019 outlook: cash utilization: $22M - 24M. IND-enabling studies for A1AT liver therapeutic tissue program to start.
    • Previously: Organovo Holdings EPS in-line, misses on revenue (May 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM | 5 Comments
  • IRDM

    Iridium jumps 15%, said to come up on Fox show

    • Iridium Communications (NASDAQ:IRDM) is heavily on the move, spiking 15.5% in a move over the past 15 minutes.
    • Chatter shows the stock came up for discussion on Fox Business' Varney & Co.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 19 Comments
  • MU

    Micron dips on rumors of Chinese office raids (update)

    • Micron (NASDAQ:MU) shares dove in early trading on rumors circulating about a supposed Brightwire report that said Micron’s Chinese offices were raided.
    • The news is not confirmed at this time.
    • Micron shares have since recovered to be up 0.8% to $58.04.
    • Update: Micron says Chinese antitrust officials visited the offices on May 31. (Source: Bloomberg First Word).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 97 Comments
  • PAVM

    PAVmed continues selloff, down 17%

    • Thinly traded nano cap PAVmed (PAVM -16.5%) slumps on more than triple normal volume. Shares have lost over 40% of their value in a month.
    • This morning, it released updated terms to its previously announced rights offering. The common stock and Series Z warrants in the units will be immediately tradable upon issuance.
    • Each unit, priced at $1.15, will be comprised of one common share and one Series Z warrant.
    • The subscription period will expire at 5:00 pm ET on Thursday, June 7, unless extended by the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • YEXT

    Yext up 6% on Q1 results, revenue guidance raised

    • Yext (YEXT +6.3%) reported Q1 net sales growth of 37.9% Y/Y to $51.1M reflecting continued growth of customer base and higher revenue from existing customers, primarily due to expanded subscriptions.
    • Q1 Gross margin improved by 108 bps to 74.95% and operating margin recovered by 629 bps to -35.23%.
    • Q1 Expenses: Selling & marketing increased 23% Y/Y to $37.03M, R&D increased by 35% Y/Y to $7.73M and G&A increased by 19% Y/Y to $11.54M.
    • Licenses to Yext's digital knowledge platform were up 49% Y/Y, while the attributes managed increased 53% Y/Y.
    • 2Q19 Outlook: EPS ($0.13) -(0.11) vs. ($0.12) consensus; revenues $53-54M vs $53.79M consensus.
    • FY19 Outlook, raised: EPS ($0.45) -(0.43) vs ($0.45) consensus; Revenues $225-227M from $224-226M earlier vs $225.09M consensus.
    • Previously: Yext beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (May 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • PBR

    Petrobras -7% on report of CEO resignation

    • Petrobras (PBR -7.4%) plunges following a report that CEO Pedro Parente has resigned.
    • Confirming the report, PBR says its board will choose an interim CEO today and that the company’s other top executives will remain.
    • Parente says in his resignation letter that his presence at the company has "stopped being positive" and that he did not want to be an "obstacle" to alternatives under discussion by Brazil's government.
    • ETFs: EWZ, BRZU, BRF, EWZS, BZQ-OLD, BRAQ, UBR, BRAZ, DBBR, FBZ
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 39 Comments
  • BOX

    Box acquires workflow automation company

    • Box (NYSE:BOX) purchases workflow startup Progressly for undisclosed terms.
    • Progressly’s 12 employees will immediately join Box.  
    • Box wants the Progressly tech and team to continue building out its automation engine and incorporate that into the Box platform.
    • Progressly raised $6M in private funding before the acquisition.

  • FIT

    Fitbit clashes with Australian regulator over warranties

    • Fitbit (FIT +2%) is facing flak in Australia as regulators there criticize the company for misleading users about faulty products.
    • The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission has received more than 100 complaints about the company's warranty policy, which the company told customers from November 2016 to March 2017 was only available for a year. Fitbit said faulty products would only be replaced for the remainder of the calendar year or 30 days, whichever was longer.
    • That's led to Fitbit agreeing to a court-enforceable undertaking to update information to consumers, along with an extension of its warranty.
    • "We were concerned that Fitbit was really saying, if you've got something wrong with your Fitbit product after 12 months, well bad luck because the warranty only lasted for a year," ACCC's Sarah Court says.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
